content.description: Position vectors <math alttext="vector A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mover><mi>A</mi><mo>→</mo></mover></math> and <math alttext="vector B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mover accent="true"><mi>B</mi><mo>→</mo></mover></math> are given as <math alttext="vector A equals, open parenthesis, 4 times i hat, plus 5 times j hat, close parenthesis, meters" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mover><mi>A</mi><mo>→</mo></mover><mo>=</mo><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mo>(</mo><mn>4</mn><mover accent="true"><mi>i</mi><mo>^</mo></mover><mo>+</mo><mn>5</mn><mover accent="true"><mi>j</mi><mo>^</mo></mover><mo>)</mo></mstyle><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mtext> m</mtext></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="vector B equals, open parenthesis, 1 times i hat, plus 7 times j hat, close parenthesis, meters" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mover accent="true"><mi>B</mi><mo>→</mo></mover><mo>=</mo><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mo>(</mo><mn>1</mn><mover accent="true"><mi>i</mi><mo>^</mo></mover><mo>+</mo><mn>7</mn><mover accent="true"><mi>j</mi><mo>^</mo></mover><mo>)</mo></mstyle><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mtext> m</mtext></mstyle></math>. What is <math alttext="vector A minus 2 times vector B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mover><mi>A</mi><mo>→</mo></mover><mo>-</mo><mn>2</mn><mover accent="true"><mi>B</mi><mo>→</mo></mover></math> in unit-vector notation form and the magnitude of this vector?
content.question: Unit-vector Notation FormMagnitudeA<math alttext="open parenthesis, 2 times i hat, minus 9 times j hat, close parenthesis, meters" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>2</mn><mover accent="true"><mi>i</mi><mo>^</mo></mover><mo>−</mo><mn>9</mn><mover accent="true"><mi>j</mi><mo>^</mo></mover><mo>)</mo></mrow><mtext> m</mtext></mstyle></math><math alttext="9.2 meters" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>9.2</mn><mtext> m</mtext></math>B<math alttext="open parenthesis, 2 times i hat, minus 9 times j hat, close parenthesis, meters" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>2</mn><mover accent="true"><mi>i</mi><mo>^</mo></mover><mo>−</mo><mn>9</mn><mover accent="true"><mi>j</mi><mo>^</mo></mover><mo>)</mo></mrow><mtext> m</mtext></mstyle></math><math alttext="7 meters" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>7</mn><mtext> m</mtext></math>C<math alttext="open parenthesis, 5 times i hat, plus 12 times j hat, close parenthesis, meters" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>5</mn><mover accent="true"><mi>i</mi><mo>^</mo></mover><mo>+</mo><mn>12</mn><mover accent="true"><mi>j</mi><mo>^</mo></mover><mo>)</mo></mrow><mtext> m</mtext></mstyle></math><math alttext="13 meters" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>13</mn><mtext> m</mtext></math>D<math alttext="open parenthesis, 5 times i hat, plus 12 times j hat, close parenthesis, meters" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>5</mn><mover accent="true"><mi>i</mi><mo>^</mo></mover><mo>+</mo><mn>12</mn><mover accent="true"><mi>j</mi><mo>^</mo></mover><mo>)</mo></mrow><mtext> m</mtext></mstyle></math><math alttext="17 meters" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>17</mn><mtext> m</mtext></math>

skill.text: 2.B: Calculate or estimate an unknown quantity with units from known quantities, by selecting and following a logical computational pathway.
